18
19#include "ByteArray.h"
20
21#include <vector>
22
23namespace ZXing {
24namespace QRCode {
25
26class Version;
27enum class ErrorCorrectionLevel;
28
29/**
30* <p>Encapsulates a block of data within a QR Code. QR Codes may split their data into
31* multiple blocks, each of which is a unit of data and error-correction codewords. Each
32* is represented by an instance of this class.</p>
33*
34* @author Sean Owen
35*/
36class DataBlock
37{
38public:
39 int numDataCodewords() const {
40 return _numDataCodewords;
41 }
42
43 const ByteArray& codewords() const {
44 return _codewords;
45 }
46
47 ByteArray& codewords() {
48 return _codewords;
49 }
50
51 /**
52 * <p>When QR Codes use multiple data blocks, they are actually interleaved.
53 * That is, the first byte of data block 1 to n is written, then the second bytes, and so on. This
54 * method will separate the data into original blocks.</p>
55 *
56 * @param rawCodewords bytes as read directly from the QR Code
57 * @param version version of the QR Code
58 * @param ecLevel error-correction level of the QR Code
59 * @return DataBlocks containing original bytes, "de-interleaved" from representation in the
60 * QR Code
61 */
62 static std::vector<DataBlock> GetDataBlocks(const ByteArray& rawCodewords, const Version& version, ErrorCorrectionLevel ecLevel);
63
64private:
65 int _numDataCodewords = 0;
66 ByteArray _codewords;
67};
68
69} // QRCode
70} // ZXing
71
